results.title: Providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 2810) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2018 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes.
results.short_title: Providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 2810) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2018 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year
results.latest_major_action: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
results.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2810)to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2018 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes.
results.summary_short: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2810)to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2018 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes.

actions.description: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 230 - 190 (Roll no. 355).
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 234 - 187 (Roll no. 354).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with further debate on H. Res. 440.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 440.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 63.
Rule provides for further consideration of H.R. 2810 under a structured rule.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-217, by Mr. Byrne.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 230 - 190 (Roll no. 355). (text: CR H5774)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 234 - 187 (Roll no. 354). (consideration: CR H5782-5783)
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H5774-5776, H5777-5783)
